definitions.definition: When a liquid overflows, it flows over the edges of a container, etc. because there is too much of it:
examples: The milk overflowed when I poured it into the jug.

definitions.definition: If a container or a place overflows, whatever is inside it starts coming out because it is too full:
examples: Oh no, the sink is overflowing all over the floor.

definitions.definition: When a place overflows, or people or things overflow from somewhere, some people or things have to come out because it cannot contain them all:
examples: The bar was so full that people were overflowing into/onto the street.

definitions.definition: so that water or another substance is almost coming over the top:
examples: Someone had filled the sink to overflowing.

definitions.definition: an amount of liquid or number of people that cannot fit in a space:
examples: I put a bucket underneath to catch the overflow from the water tank.
